text.section-title: ACBA-CREDIT AGRICOLE BANK UNVEILS NEW ARCA CREDIT CARD WITH DECLINING-BALANCE
text.p: ACBA-CREDIT AGRICOLE BANK has unveiled today new ArCa Credit cards with declining-balance for getting credit lines. The cards validity term is five years. They can be used throughout Armenia to make both encashment and payment transactions, the bank said in a press release.

Unlike standard credit lines, equal amounts, set by the bank are deducted monthly from the credit lines with the declining balance allowing customers to make regular payments and zero their credit commitments.

Customers can get credit lines with the declining-balance in the amount of up to 500,000 drams or an equivalent amount in foreign currency without a document certifying one's income. The maximum amount of the credit line with the declining balance is 10 million drams or the equivalent in foreign currency.

Visa Electron, Maestro or MasterCard UEFA Champions League, issued by the bank, can be connected to ArCa Credit card account. Thanks to it the bank's customers will be able to use credit funds also outside Armenia.
Sources: www.armbanks.am 06.03.2015, www.arka.am 06.03.2015, www.banks.am 06.03.2015, www.finport.am 06.03.2015, www.panorama.am 06.03.2015
text.section-title: ACBA-CREDIT AGRICOLE BANK INSTALLS ACBA TOKEN APP FOR LOGGING TO ACBA ON-LINE
text.p: ACBA-CREDIT AGRICOLE BANK has installed ACBA TOKEN application for creating single-use passwords for logging to ACBA ON-LINE system for management of bank accounts

According to a bank's press release, ACBA ON-LINE was first introduced back in 2009 in tune with ACBA-CREDIT AGRICOLE BANK's policy of improving the quality of services and bringing in innovative solutions.

Previously, when logging to ACBA ON-LINE customers could create one-time passwords only by using the TOKEN device. Now, customers can use their smartphones running on iOS or Android to create passwords by using the ACBA TOKEN application. The app allows customers to manage their bank accounts at any time from anywhere in the world.

Corporate customers can use the new application to create one-time passwords and log in to a system that enables them to manage accounts of several companies they own. Earlier corporate customers had to have devices for each account.
Customers can switch to ACBA TOKEN application without having to visit the bank. They need only to visit a section on ACBA ON-LINE's website called "replacing mobile token.'

ACBA ON-LINE service enables customers to manage their accounts online 24 hours a day, including opening of current accounts, placing deposits, repaying loans, applying for overdrafts and commercial lines of credit, make remittances, apply for consumer loans and deposit-secured lines of credit, pay for goods bought on installment plan, pay utility bills and send applications for a certificate.
Sources: www.armbanks.am 02.03.2015, www.arka.am 02.03.2015, www.banks.am 02.03.2015, www.arminfo.am 02.03.2015, www.panorama.am 02.03.2015
text.section-title: ARTSAKH BANK INCREASES ITS AUTHORIZED CAPITAL BY 4.5 BILLION DRAMS
text.p: Artsakh Bank's authorized capital has increased by 4.5 billion drams to 11 billion drams due to a new shareholder, which is Business Fund of Armenia, the bank said in a statement posted on its official website.

It said the increased capital will be used to implement priority development programs, such as improving customer services, stimulating universal banking services and more diversified lending through microfinance programs.
On February 10, Arthur Mkhitaryan was elected as new CEO and board chairman of Artsakh Bank.
Sources: www.armbanks.am 04.03.2015, www.banks.am 04.03.2015
text.section-title: VTB BANK (ARMENIA), VISA INTERNATIONAL PAYMENT SYSTEM AND COSMOPOLITAN MAGAZINE HAVE OFFER FOR VTB COSMOPOLITAN CARDHOLDERS
text.p: VTB Bank (Armenia), Visa international payment system and Cosmopolitan magazine have a join offer for all holders of VTB Cosmopolitan Visa Classic and VTB CosmopolitanVisa Gold cards ahead of the women's holidays, the press office of VTB Bank (Armenia) reports.

Then offer applies also to the cards bought while the offer is in force. All VTB Cosmopolitan Visa card holders, making shopping frequently from March 1 to May 31, will get a chance to win two trips for Milan and 10 gift certificates for purchasing goods in women's shops.
The prizes will be raffled among 100 clients, who spent much money over the mentioned period through their cards. Minimum amount of cashless purchases is 100,000 drams.
Sources: www.armbanks.am 06.03.2015, www.arka.am 06.03.2015, www.banks.am 06.03.2015, www.finport.am 06.03.2015\
text.section-title: NUMBER OF ARMENIAN BANKS' CLIENTS RISES 19.3% TO 2.6 MILLION IN DECEMBER 2014
text.p: Armenia's banks had 2,267,152 clients in late December 2014 - a 19.3% growth, compared with December 2013, the National Statistical Service told ARKA News Agency.
Of them, 79,588 are corporate clients and 2,187, 564 are individuals.
There were 3,910,808 accounts in the country's banks in late December 2014 against 3,201,229 in 2013.
According to the statistical report, 3,734,932 of them are individuals' account and 175,876 are corporate clients' accounts.

Balance in the population deposits in banks amounted to AMD 884 333 million in late January 2015 after shrinking 1.1% or by AMD 9 819 million, compared with the previous month, but growing 11.8% or by AMD 93 122 million, compared with January 2014.
Source: www.armbanks.am 05.03.2015
text.section-title: ARMENIAN COMMERCIAL BANKS' TOTAL LIQUIDITY DROPS 4.4 PERCENTAGE POINTS TO 25.1% IN 2014
text.p: Armenian commercial banks' total liquidity rate (high-liquidity assets/total assets) fell 4.4 percentage points to 25.1% in 2014, according to the figures posted on the website of the Central Bank of Armenia. The regulator says the banks' total activity indicator was slipping smoothly, unlike their current liquidity indicator (high-liquidity assets/demand liabilities), which dropped 12.9 percentage points from 142.3% in the beginning of 2014 to 129.4% by the end of the year. The indicator plummeted 5.7% in December, after the central bank raised its requirement to obligatory reservation in foreign currencies from 12% to 24% (now it stands at 20%), to 129.4% from 135% in November. Nevertheless, it should be mentioned that Armenian banks' liquidity, either total or current, exceeds the minimum requirement of the regulator - 15% required total liquidity minimum (25.1% at banks) and 60% required current liquidity minimum (129.4% at banks). Some analysts warn that although the central bank has lowered its requirement to banks' mandatory reservation in foreign currencies to 20%, it is still high and may continue pressing the banks' liquidity level.
Source: www.armbanks.am 03.03.2015
text.section-title: ARMENIAN COMMERCIAL BANKS' ROA 0.91% AND ROE 5.58% IN 2014
text.p: Armenian commercial banks' Return on Assets (ROA), an indicator of how profitable a company is relative to its total assets, averaged 0.91% in 2014 against 1.81% in late 2013. The profitability of assets fell 0.37% over one quarter. Inecobank is topping ARKA News Agency's ranking based on comparable analysis - its ROA was recorded at 3.83% in 2014 against 4.21% in 2013. Armswisbank, with its 3.12% against 2.98%, came second in the ranking, HSBC Bank Armenia, with 2.53% against 3.55%, came third, Araratbank, with 2.39% and 2.75% respectively, fourth and Ameriabank, with 2.08% and 1.97% fifth. An average Return on Equity (ROE), the amount of net income returned as a percentage of shareholders equity, of the country's commercial banks stood at 5.58% in 2014 against 11.12% in late 2013. Inecobank, with its 21% against 23.90% a year earlier, came first here. Ameriabank, with 17.82 against 15.96%, ranked second, HSBC Bank Armenia, with 14.71% against 20.36%, third, Araratbank, with 13.90% against 17.17%, fourth and Armbusinessbank, with 13.26 against 11.71% fifth.
Source: www.armbanks.am 03.03.2015

md.descriptions.md.title: QUALCOMM DEVELOPS FINGERPRINT SENSOR FOR SMARTPHONES

news.metadata.block.md.text.preview: INFORMATION TECHNOLOGIESYEREVAN, March 4, /ARKA/. Qualcomm has developed its own fingerprint sensor for smartphones with the aim of tapping the increasing demand for biometric security on phones, newsru.com reported. Qualcomm's Snapdragon Sense ID,

title.sort-title: QUALCOMM DEVELOPS FINGERPRINT SENSOR FOR SMARTPHONES

text.p: YEREVAN, March 4, /ARKA/. Qualcomm has developed its own fingerprint sensor for smartphones with the aim of tapping the increasing demand for biometric security on phones, newsru.com reported. Qualcomm's Snapdragon Sense ID, announced on Monday at Mobile World Congress, isn't the usual capacitive touch pad. Instead Qualcomm is using ultrasonic waves to scan all of the ridges and wrinkles of one's digits.

Qualcomm says it can do a far deeper analysis than the 2D image created by a fingerprint mashed up against a capacitive sensor. It can look beyond the grime and sweat on one's grubby fingers and even penetrate beneath the surface of your skin to identify unique 3D characteristics of one's print. It's the same biometric technology developed for government security applications, Qualcomm claimed.

The technology could also change the way that fingerprint scanners are implemented on devices. Since ultrasonic waves go through glass, aluminum, steel and plastic housings of any phone, it doesn't need a dedicated touch pad or button to work. While the sensor itself is a separate element, it's designed to work closely with Qualcomm's Snapdragon processor line where all of the fingerprint data analysis is performed.
Qualcomm says it is already sampling the technology with device makers and expect it to debut in the first commercial handsets later this year.-0-

md.descriptions.md.title: FIVE ETHNIC ARMENIANS ARE IN FORBES LIST OF BILLIONAIRES

news.metadata.block.md.text.preview: FINANCIAL NEWSYEREVAN, March 3. / ARKA /. Five ethnic Armenians have been included in Forbes 2015 World's Billionaires list released on March 2. They are Kirk Kerkorian (USA), Samvel Karapetyan, Danil Khachaturov, Sergey Galitsky (Russia) and

title.sort-title: FIVE ETHNIC ARMENIANS ARE IN FORBES LIST OF BILLIONAIRES

text.p: YEREVAN, March 3. / ARKA /. Five ethnic Armenians have been included in Forbes 2015 World's Billionaires list released on March 2. They are Kirk Kerkorian (USA), Samvel Karapetyan, Danil Khachaturov, Sergey Galitsky (Russia) and Eduardo Eurnekian (Argentina).

Sergei Galitsky (162nd) was named the world's richest Armenian with an estimated net worth of $8.3 billion. Kirk Kerkorian (393rd) was worth $ 4.2 billion; Samvel Karapetyan, head of Tashir group of companies with en estimated wealth of $4 billion was 418th, Eduardo Eurnekian with $1.9 billion was 1006th and Danil Khachaturov, CEO of Rosgosstrakh insurance company was 1190th with $1.6 billion.
Brothers Sergei Sarkisov and Nikolai Sarkisov (both ranked 1465th last year) dropped out of the ranks. The total capital of ethnic Armenian billionaires was $20 billion.

According to Forbes, despite plunging oil prices and a weakened euro, the ranks of the world's wealthiest defied global economic turmoil and expanded yet again. For the 29th annual guide to the globe's richest, the Forbes has found a record 1,826 billionaires with an aggregate net worth of $7.05 trillion, up from $6.4 trillion a year ago. The total includes 290 newcomers, 71 of whom hail from China. Youth are on the rise: a record 46 among the ranks are under age 40.

Bill Gates is once again the richest person on the planet, a title he's held for 16 of the past 21 years. His fortune grew $3.2 billion since last year to $79.2 billion, despite a gift of $1.5 billion in Microsoft shares to The Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation in November 2014. Carlos Slim Helu of Mexico comes in again at No. 2 while revered American investor Warren Buffett took back the No. 3 spot from Spain's Amancio Ortega (now No. 4).

Facebook's Mark Zuckerberg moves up 5 spots to number 16, his first time ranked among the world's 20 richest. Zuckerberg is also the leader in a youth revolution that has minted 46 billionaires under the age of 40. The youngest billionaire on the planet is Evan Spiegel, 24, co-founder of photo- messaging app Snapchat.-0-

md.descriptions.md.title: MICROSOFT TO LAY OFF 9000 EMPLOYEES

news.metadata.block.md.text.preview: INFORMATION TECHNOLOGIESYEREVAN, February 26. / ARKA /. Microsoft is set to shut down its Nokia mobile phone factories in Beijing and Dongguan by the end of the first quarter of the yea, Novosti-Armenia reported citing RIA Novosti. The closures

title.sort-title: MICROSOFT TO LAY OFF 9000 EMPLOYEES

text.p: YEREVAN, February 26. / ARKA /. Microsoft is set to shut down its Nokia mobile phone factories in Beijing and Dongguan by the end of the first quarter of the yea, Novosti-Armenia reported citing RIA Novosti. The closures could lead to the company laying off about 9,000 employees, according to a Beijing Youth Daily report which said Microsoft is switching its phone manufacturing to Hanoi, Vietnam.
The move is part of the company's plans to cut 18,000 jobs worldwide, with facilities set for closure connected to Nokia's mobile phone manufacturing operation, the report said.

Microsoft announced in July last year that it will adjust its mobile phone business to adapt to the latest developments in cloud computing. The company then announced a plan on Dec. 17 to shut down its factories in Beijing and Dongguan and shift its phone manufacturing to Hanoi.

Microsoft took over Nokia's phone business in a US$7.2 billion deal last April, the world's largest phone business acquisition deal. Following the deal, Microsoft announced last July that it was cutting 18,000 jobs, or about 14% of its full-time workforce. It is the largest layoff in the company's history and 12,500 of these jobs are related to Microsoft's acquisition of Nokia's mobile phone business. The worldwide layoffs are set to be completed by June.

Microsoft's restructuring plan reflects dramatic shifts in the global mobile phone industry, given the short product life-cycle and high product turnover rate in recent years. The advent of the smartphone era has also seen a number Chinese phone makers produce a diverse range of quality smartphones in addition to global brands like Apple and Samsung.-0-

md.descriptions.md.title: AUTHORIZATION BY ARCA PAYMENT CARDS AND TERMINALS HALTED TEMPORARILY

news.metadata.block.md.text.preview: BANKING NEWSYEREVAN, February 25. / ARKA /. Authorization by ArCa payment cards and terminals was halted temporarily due to a technical problem, the executive director of the payment system, Ishham Mkhitaryan, said to ARKA news agency. He said

title.sort-title: AUTHORIZATION BY ARCA PAYMENT CARDS AND TERMINALS HALTED TEMPORARILY

text.p: BANKING NEWS

YEREVAN, February 25. / ARKA /. Authorization by ArCa payment cards and terminals was halted temporarily due to a technical problem, the executive director of the payment system, Ishham Mkhitaryan, said to ARKA news agency. He said experts were working to eliminate the problem.
He said the company apologizes for any inconvenience this might cause.

Armenian Card CJSC was established on March 16, 2000 as a united national payment system. Today 19 of Armenia's 21 commercial banks participate in ArCa payment system. The company is a full member of MasterCard Europe international payment system. It also processes VISA and American Express (Third Party Processor) cards. It issues ArCa Debit, ArCa Classic, ArCa Gold, ArCa Business, ArCa Affinity, ArCa Co-branded, ArCa Platinum, as well as ArCa pension cards.-0-

md.descriptions.md.title: ARMENTEL, NURCARD OFFER 'NICE PHONE NUMBERS" FOR HOLDERS OF MASTERCARD NURCARD GOLD

news.metadata.block.md.text.preview: COMMUNICATIONSYEREVAN, February 24. /ARKA/. ArmenTel telecommunication company (trading as Beeline), together with NURCARD, has launched a new "nice phone number" service for holders of Mastercard NurCard Gold, the company's press office reported

title.sort-title: ARMENTEL, NURCARD OFFER 'NICE PHONE NUMBERS" FOR HOLDERS OF MASTERCARD NURCARD GOLD

text.p: COMMUNICATIONS

YEREVAN, February 24. /ARKA/. ArmenTel telecommunication company (trading as Beeline), together with NURCARD, has launched a new "nice phone number" service for holders of Mastercard NurCard Gold, the company's press office reported on Monday.

The service gives the cardholders an opportunity of getting a 'gold phone number' from Beeline for free, while getting connected to "All in 3500-Nur" or "All in 5500-Nur" or "All in 7500-Nur"mobile tariff plans for 12 months, says the report.
Beeline's tariff policies aim at providing the best comfort to clients at the best price, said Andrey Pyatakhin, general director of ArmenTel.

If the respective contract is suspended in the first 12 months or the tariff plan is changed, the subscriber will have to pay the cost of the 'gold number". If the change occurs within the mentioned tariff plans, the amount for the 'nice number' is not charged and 12 months is counted from the change date.
Clients can obtain the service at Beeline and NURCARD service centers. Additional info is available on
wwwHYPERLINK "http://www.beeline.am/".HYPERLINK "http://www.beeline.am/"beelineHYPERLINK "http://www.beeline.am/".HYPERLINK "http://www.beeline.am/"am.
ArmenTel is owned fully by Russian VimpelCom. It provides fixed and mobile telephony services and high speed Internet. N.V. -0-

md.descriptions.md.title: GENIUM INET PLATFORM TO BE INTRODUCED IN THE ARMENIAN STOCK EXCHANGE IN 2015

news.metadata.block.md.text.preview: STOCK MARKETYEREVAN, February 24. /ARKA/. Genium INET modern stock exchange platform, will be introduced in NASDAQ OMX Armenia this year, director of the stock exchange Konstantin Saroyan said.

title.sort-title: GENIUM INET PLATFORM TO BE INTRODUCED IN THE ARMENIAN STOCK EXCHANGE IN 2015

text.p: STOCK MARKET
YEREVAN, February 24. /ARKA/. Genium INET modern stock exchange platform, will be introduced in NASDAQ OMX Armenia this year, director of the stock exchange Konstantin Saroyan said.
It is the commercial trading system of NASDAQ OMX Group and will be applied in the Armenian market this year, he said.
In the beginning the platform will be used for government bonds, but later it will expand into the secondary market as well, Saroyan said.

NASDAQ OMX Armenia (former Armenian Stock Exchange, Armex), was established in 2001 as a voluntary merger of 21 broker (dealer) companies. In November 2007 the stock exchange was reorganized into OJSC. OMX (current NASDAQ OMX) is a holder of 100% stock of NASDAQ OMX Armenia. The stock exchange obtained 100% stock of Armenia's Central Depository. NASDAQ OMX Armenia received a trade license from CBA on November 7, 2005. The trades on the stock exchange were officially launched on 15 November 2005. N.V. -0--

title.sort-title: PRESS-CLIPPING

text.p: The monitoring of Armenian media reports regarding the activities of local banks from February 16 to 20 shows that the then breaking news was that Ameriabank's profit in 2014 increased by almost 18% to 7.1 billion drams.
Ameriabank CEO Artak Hanesyan said optimal number of banks serving the Armenian economy should not exceed 12.
Ameriabank Development Director Tigran Jrbashyan was quoted in media reports as saying that Armenian banks may face difficulties in attracting additional capital.

It has also become known from media reports that Armenia's ACBA-CREDIT AGRICOLE BANK and Nature and Biodiversity Conservation Union (NABU), one of the oldest and largest environment associations in Germany, have signed an agreement to join efforts for protection of Armenia's environment and create favorable conditions for the development of ecotourism.
The staff of Areximbank-Gazprombank Group has raised money for multiple-kid families.
Armenia-based Anelik Bank held a special ceremony today to award winners of a completion it had announced earlier for customers using money transfer systems.
VTB Bank (Armenia) has announced a special offer designed for its individual customers wishing to use its Internet banking service.
The media reports released by newspapers and Internet resources over the period between February 2 and 6 contained information about five commercial banks.

Azg, Golos Armenii, Novoe Vremya, Aravot, Delovoy Express, Hayastani Hanrapetutyun, Respublika Armenia, Haykakan Zhamanak, Hayots Ashkhar, Iravunk, Orakarg, Yerkir, Hraparak, Chorrord Ishkhanutyun, Zhamanak, Zhoghovurd and 168 Zham newspapers were used to collect the information.
Panarmenian, ARKA, Armbanks, Banks, Arminfo, Finport and Panorama and Ebank Internet resources were used as well. ---0---
text.section-title: AMERIABANK'S PROFIT INCREASE BY ALMOST 18% IN 2014 TO 7.1 BILLION DRAMS
text.p: Ameriabank's profit in 2014 increased by almost 18% to 7.1 billion drams, according to the bank's chief financial officer Gevorg Tarumyan.
Speaking at a news conference today he said Ameriabank's profit came against the backdrop of a downturn trend in the market with the banking sector seeing its profit decrease by 41% in 2014.
"The past year was dynamic enough; the bank was able to demonstrate strong performance throughout the year and become the leading bank by all indicators,' said Tarumyan.

He said the bank's assets increased by almost 27% to about 400 billion drams, while the growth rate for the banking sector was 16%. According to him, the liabilities increased by more than 29% to 357.4 billion drams, while the figure for the banking sector was 18%.

He said also customer funds grew by 23% to 209 billion drams, while the figure for the sector was only 4.8%. Also the number of individual customers increased by 23% and the number of corporate customers by 17%.

The amount of individual deposits rose by 27% to 86 billion drams, while current accounts grew by almost 17%. "These figures show that Ameriabank is a reliable bank, which people choose to place their deposits in although the interest rates are not high,' said Tarumyan.

He also said the bank's credit portfolio rose by 63% to 286 billion drams, while the figure for the sector was only 21%. According to him, the growth was due to a 73% rise in lending to small and medium-sized businesses, which is the bank target segment; consumer loans grew by 2.6 times and mortgage lending by 67%.
Sources: www.arka.am 17.02.2015, www.banks.am 17.02.2015, www.arminfo.am 17.02.2015, www.panarmenian.net 17.02.2015, www.panorama.am 17.02.2015
text.section-title: ACBA-CREDIT AGRICOLE BANK AND GERMANY'S NABU TO SUPPORT DEVELOPMENT OF ECOTOURISM IN ARMENIA
text.p: Armenia's ACBA-CREDIT AGRICOLE BANK and Nature and Biodiversity Conservation Union (NABU), one of the oldest and largest environment associations in Germany, have signed an agreement to join efforts for protection of Armenia's environment and create favorable conditions for the development of ecotourism, the Bank said in a press release.

It said cooperation framework includes organization and implementation of measures to improve environmental education, assisting eco-products producing SMEs in certification of their goods and support to farms and ecotourism.
Sources: www.armbanks.am 20.02.2015, www.arka.am 20.02.2015, www.banks.am 20.02.2015, www.finport.am 20.02.2015, www.panorama.am 20.02.2015
text.section-title: AREXIMBANK-GAZPROMBANK GROUP MAKES DONATIONS TO MULTI-CHILD FAMILIES
text.p: The staff of Areximbank-Gazprombank Group has collected donations for multiple-kid families, the bank's press office reported.
The report says Areximbank-Gazprombank Group and Armenia Tourism magazine continue their charities and will hand over the donations to the committee of multi-children families this time.
Advisor to general director of the bank Yelena Markova said the bank has been focused on the needs of poor families in its social programs since long ago.
She said this time they collected warm clothes, shoes, toys and children's books and textbooks in Armenian, Russian and English. She also urged other Armenian business to join their charities.
Sources: www.armbanks.am 19.02.2015, www.banks.am 19.02.2015, www.finport.am 19.02.2015, www.arminfo.am 19.02.2015
text.section-title: ANELIK BANK'S CALENDAR THE BEST IN THE BANKS' COMPETITION
text.p: The 2015 calendar prepared by Anelik Bank was acknowledged to be the best at a competition held by the trade union of banks and credit organizations, the press office of the bank reported.
Some fourteen banks and one credit organization participated in the contest.
The diploma was handed to the winner on February 19 at an official awarding ceremony in the Central Bank of Armenia.
The head of PR at the bank Astghik Martirosyan said their marketing team had thoroughly worked over the calendar to summarize the history of money which was selected as a topic.
Source: www.armbanks.am 20.02.2015
text.section-title: ANELIK BANK AWARDS WINNERS OF MONEY TRANSFER COMPETITION
text.p: Armenia-based Anelik Bank held a special ceremony today to award winners of a completion it had announced earlier for customers using money transfer systems. The competition was designed for all those customers, who would send or receive money transfers from November 1 to December 30, 2014 regardless of the amounts and frequency of remittances. The drawing of prizes was held on January 23.
Deputy CEO of the bank, Hayk Mkrtchyan, handed the prizes - tablets, smartphones and certificates for free subscription to Internet services for a period of three months.

A press officer for the bank, Astghik Martirosyan, called on winners who were not present at the award ceremony, to look for their names on the list of awardees on the website of the bank or on its page in Facebook and visit the bank to get their gifts.

She was quoted as saying in a press release that the bank will continue to organize similar competitions, special offers and promotions especially in 2015 which marks the 25th anniversary of Anelik Bank.
Sources: www.armbanks.am 19.02.2015, www.banks.am 19.02.2015
text.section-title: VTB BANK (ARMENIA) ANNOUNCES SPECIAL INTERNET BANKING OFFER FOR ITS INDIVIDUAL CUSTOMERS
text.p: VTB Bank (Armenia) has announced a special offer designed for its individual customers wishing to use its Internet banking service. The special offer will be effective from February 16 to June 16. The offer applies also to those who will become a client of the bank during this promotional period.
"All customers of the bank who will subscribe to Internet banking service during this period will be given free three-month Internet banking,' the bank said in a press release.

Internet banking services launched by VTB Bank (Armenia) in 2013 is an easy and convenient way for the customers to remotely manage their accounts at the bank. This service enables customers to track also the status of their accounts, make money transfers and payments, to convert instantly a foreign currency to pay Internet, mobile communications, utilities bills, repay loans and so on. The service allows making speedy and absolutely reliable payments and transactions at any time and any day from home or from anywhere in the world.
Sources: www.armbanks.am 20.02.2015, www.banks.am 20.02.2015
text.section-title: ARMENIAN BANKS MAY FACE DIFFICULTIES IN ATTRACTING ADDITIONAL CAPITAL, AMERIABANK DEVELOPMENT DIRECTOR SAYS
text.p: Armenian banks may face difficulties in attracting additional capital, Ameriabank Development Director Tigran Jrbashyan said.

Speaking at a news conference he said Armenian banking sector's index of return on capital is 2-3 times lower than in other former Soviet republics, 'which means that Armenian banks will face difficulties in raising additional capital, as the risks in the region are identical, while the return is lower."
He said in the last three years Armenian banking system developed extensively, while increasing lending was accompanied by a reduction of returns.

'In particular, if the pace of development of the banking system over the past three years was higher than the GDP growth rate - thus the ratio of loans to GDP rose from 40% in 2012 to 47.7% in 2014 to become comparable with Russia's index, but compared with other countries it still remains at a low level,' he said..

According to him, the situation is the same with respect to assets and deposits. Thus, the ratio of assets to GDP at the end of 2014 was 75.8%, while the ratio of deposits to GDP was 37.8%, which were higher than in neighboring Georgia, where assets to GDP ratio was 70.1% and the ratio of deposits to GDP was 31.4% , but the figure for Armenia was lower than in Russia or Bulgaria.

"Under circumstances of high competition, such indicators were achieved at the expense of profitability. In terms of ROA ratio (return on assets) Armenia is ahead of Eastern and Central Europe countries, where ROA is fairly low, but Armenia's figure is smaller than in other former Soviet republics, which suggests that our assets are used by the banks less effectively," said Jrbashyan.
Sources: www.armbanks.am 17.02.2015, www.arminfo.am 17.02.2015
text.section-title: INTEREST RATES ON LOANS IN FOREIGN CURRENCIES ARE LIKELY TO RISE SLIGHTLY SOON - HANESYAN
text.p: Interest rates on loans in foreign currencies are likely to rise slightly soon, Ameriabank CEO Artak Hanesyan said last week.
In his words the increase of obligatory reservation requirement by the central bank has driven interest on dram deposits up.

In his words, environment for attraction of dram deposits and reduction of dollarization is favorable now at Armenia's banking market, and taking this into account, the banks should raise interests on lending in foreign currencies to retain at least minimum effectiveness. "It means interest rates on loans in foreign currencies will slightly rise now or s little later," Hanesyan said.
Sources: www.armbanks.am 17.02.2015, www.arminfo.am 17.02.2015
text.section-title: SOME 10-12 BANKS SUFFICIENT FOR ARMENIAN ECONOMY - OPINION
text.p: Optimal number of banks serving the Armenian economy should not exceed 10-12, chairman of board and general director of Ameriabank Artak Hanesyan said.
At its council meeting on December 30, 2014, the central bank decided to raise the minimum capital requirement for commercial banks from 5 billion drams up o30 billion drams.

This decision will help not only increase capital, but also enhance the stability of the banking system and ensure its further development, as the capital adequacy norm is closer to central bank's norm now, and the system cannot go on developing in tune with the economy, Hanesyan said.
Head of development at Ameriabank Tigran Jrbashyan, in his turn, said the bank consolidation process is underway, with low motivation level in credit organizations though.
According to Jrbashyan, the next two years will be a period of market consolidation - mergers, acquisitions, new actors with new statuses and possibilities.
Consolidation is not an end in itself, but a tool to raise efficiency, Jrbashyan said.
Low funding levels will be recorded in the market in the near future as it is the time to get prepared, to recover and consolidate now, he said.
Sources: www.armbanks.am 17.02.2015, www.arminfo.am 17.02.2015
text.section-title: ARMENIA'S BANKING SYSTEM SHOWED GOOD GROWTH RATE IN 2014, AMERIABANK CEO SAYS
text.p: Armenia's banking system showed a good growth rate in 2014, Ameriabank CEO Artak Hanesyan said.

Speaking at a news conference he said the banking system's assets increased by 16%, while their total capital saw a 4% rise. Also the banks' credit investments surged by 21%, "which is a good indicator of growth, taking into account the fact that 2014 was quite difficult in terms of lending due to a significant deterioration in asset quality."
Hanesyan noted also that due to intense competition in 2014 a reduction in interest rates on deposits as well as on lending was recorded.
He also said loans to legal entities increased by 23%, while time deposits increased by 9.8%. Lending to individuals grew by s 21%.
Sources: www.arka.am 17.02.2015, www.banks.am 17.02.2015
text.section-title: RANKING OF ARMENIAN BANKS BY SIZE OF CAPITAL IN 2014
text.p: ARKA news agency has released a fresh ranking of 21 commercial banks operating in Armenia by size of their capital as of late 2014.

The ranking is interesting in the context of a latest decision of the Central Bank of Armenia to raise the minimum amount of commercial banks' total capital to 30 billion drams from the current 5 billion drams from January 1, 2017.

According to 2014 data, the total capital of only five Armenian banks met and even exceeded the new requirement, while four banks' capital was below 10 billion drams. Another 12 banks' capital ranged from 10 to 30 billion drams. It turns out that 16 banks have two years ahead to meet the new requirement.
According to ARKA's ranking, the aggregate capital of all 21 Armenia-based commercial banks stood at about 488.7 billion drams, having increased by 4.17 percent from the previous year.

The largest five banks in terms of capital were ACBA-CREDIT AGRICOLE BANK, Ardshinbank, HSBC Bank Armenia, VTB Bank (Armenia) and Ameriabank, which had a total of 230.8 billion drams of capital (47.2 percent of the total).

ACBA-CREDIT AGRICOLE BANK's capital stood at 49.4 billion drams. Its share in the aggregate capital was 10.1 percent, although its capital slashed by 8.82 percent from 2013. It was followed by Ardshinbank with 47.4 billion drams (an increase of 7.43 percent since the beginning of the year). It accounted for 9.7 percent of the total.
HSBC Bank Armenia with a capital of about 47 billion drams (an increase of 13.76 percent) was third. Its share of the total capital was 9.6 percent.
The fourth position in the ranking was held by VTB Bank (Armenia) with a capital of about 44.8 billion drams (a growth of 20.2 percent). It accounted for of 9.2 percent of the total.
The fifth bank by size of capital was Ameriabank with 42.3 billion drams (up 9.43 percent). Its share of the total was 8.7 percent.
Source: www.armbanks.am 16.02.2015
text.section-title: AGGREGATE DEPOSITS IN ARMENIA'S BANKS GROW 7 PERCENT TO AMD 1 617 7.BILLION IN 2014
text.p: Aggregate deposits in Armenia's banks grew 7 percent in 2014 to AMD 1 617 7.billion, according to ARKA News Agency's Financial and Economic Bulletin for the 4th Q 2014.

Ameriabank, Ardshinbank, HSBC Bank Armenia, VTB Bank (Armenia) and Armbusinessbank were singled out in the bulletin for the largest amounts of deposits, which totaled AMD 847.6 billion and made up 52.3% of the total deposits of the all banks of the country in 2014.
Ameriabank's share here was 12.9% and deposits amounted to about AMD 208.7 billion in late 2014 after growing 22.8% over the year.

Deposits in Ardshinbank amounted to AMD 179.9 billion with 25% growth, in HSBC Bank Armenia AMD 171 billion and 8.22% respectively, in VTB Bank (Armenia) AMD 151 billion and 9.46% growth and Armbusinessbank AMD 136.8 billion and 23.51%.
Source: www.armbanks.am 18.02.2015

md.descriptions.md.title: NASDAQ OMX ARMENIA STOCK EXCHANGE TO LAUNCH ONLINE PLATFORM FOR TRADING OF GOVERNMENT BONDS

news.metadata.block.md.text.preview: STOCK MARKETYEREVAN, February 23. / ARKA /. NASDAQ OMX Armenia stock exchange will launch an online platform for trading of government bonds, the head of the exchange Konstantin Saroyan said today. He said the on-line platform will allow

title.sort-title: NASDAQ OMX ARMENIA STOCK EXCHANGE TO LAUNCH ONLINE PLATFORM FOR TRADING OF GOVERNMENT BONDS

text.p: STOCK MARKET

YEREVAN, February 23. / ARKA /. NASDAQ OMX Armenia stock exchange will launch an online platform for trading of government bonds, the head of the exchange Konstantin Saroyan said today. He said the on-line platform will allow individuals to also participate in on-line trading. According to him, it is very important for the exchanges that this plan succeeds.

"It is no secret that many banks prefer off-exchange trade of government bonds, but NASDAQ OMX Armenia will try to prove that transactions with government bonds effected through the exchange are more profitable and more attractive," he said.
Saroyan said the market of government bonds doubled in 2014 with 924 transactions worth about 34 billion, up from 484 transactions worth 15 billion drams effected in 2013.

NASDAQ OMX Armenia is the new name of the Armenian Stock Exchange ojsc (renamed on January 27, 2009), however, it is also used to refer jointly to the stock exchange and the Central Depository of Armenia ojsc (CDA), as the both companies have been members of the NASDAQ OMX Group, Inc. since early 2008.

NASDAQ OMX Armenia and the CDA are the major securities market infrastructure institutions in Armenia. Since their inception in 2000, both companies had operated as self-regulatory organizations established by member broker companies, up until demutualization in 2007. NASDAQ OMX Armenia is a part of the world's largest exchange company, the NASDAQ OMX Group, Inc.($478.95 drams). --0--

md.descriptions.md.title: ARMENIAN SECURITIES MAY BECOME AVAILABLE AT INTERNATIONAL MARKETS WITHIN ONE OR ONE AND HALF YEAR

news.metadata.block.md.text.preview: STOCK MARKETYEREVAN, February 23./ARKA/. Armenian securities may become available at international markets within one or one and a half year, Konstantin Saroyan, head of NASDAQ OMX Armenia stock exchange said on Monday.

title.sort-title: ARMENIAN SECURITIES MAY BECOME AVAILABLE AT INTERNATIONAL MARKETS WITHIN ONE OR ONE AND HALF YEAR

text.p: STOCK MARKET

YEREVAN, February 23./ARKA/. Armenian securities may become available at international markets within one or one and a half year, Konstantin Saroyan, head of NASDAQ OMX Armenia stock exchange said on Monday.
"We have already started negotiating the matter with Clearstream Banking SA," he said.
In his words, in 2014 an account was opened jointly with Clearstream Banking SA on an ex parte basis to make foreign securities available in Armenia.

"Armenian securities' entrance into international markets is more complicated process than account-opening procedure, since Clearstream has to explore and assess the Armenian market and release its verdict on reasonability of opening an account in Armenia," Saroyan said.

He said in 2014 the Central Depository of Armenia opened an account in Clearstream Banking Luxemburg Clearstream Deutsche Borse Group, and the next step will be the opening by Clearstream Banking SA an account in the Central Depository of Armenia for making Armenian securities available to foreign investors.
Thnaks to the ties established with Clearstream Deutsche Borse Group, Armenian investors can make investments in securities in 53 developed and developing countries.
Clearstream Banking SA is the clearing and settlement division of Deutsche Borse based on Luxembourg and Frankfurt.

NASDAQ OMX Armenia is the new name of the Armenian Stock Exchange ojsc (renamed on January 27, 2009), however, it is also used to refer jointly to the stock exchange and the Central Depository of Armenia ojsc (CDA), as the both companies have been members of the NASDAQ OMX Group, Inc. since early 2008.

NASDAQ OMX Armenia and the CDA are the major securities market infrastructure institutions in Armenia. Since their inception in 2000, both companies had operated as self-regulatory organizations established by member broker companies, up until demutualization in 2007. NASDAQ OMX Armenia is a part of the world's largest exchange company, the NASDAQ OMX Group, Inc. ($1 - 478.95 drams). M.V. --0--

md.descriptions.md.title: SOME 1.461 TRILLION DRAMS WORTH BONDS WERE DEPOSITED AT CENTRAL DEPOSITORY OF ARMENIA IN LATE 2014

news.metadata.block.md.text.preview: STOCK MARKETYEREVAN, February 23. / ARKA /. Some 1.461 trillion drams worth securities (bonds) were deposited at the Central Depository of Armenia at the end of 2014, of which 1.423.5 trillion drams were corporate securities, Vahan Stepanyan, head

title.sort-title: SOME 1.461 TRILLION DRAMS WORTH BONDS WERE DEPOSITED AT CENTRAL DEPOSITORY OF ARMENIA IN LATE 2014

text.p: STOCK MARKET

YEREVAN, February 23. / ARKA /. Some 1.461 trillion drams worth securities (bonds) were deposited at the Central Depository of Armenia at the end of 2014, of which 1.423.5 trillion drams were corporate securities, Vahan Stepanyan, head of the Central depository said today.
He said foreign currency-denominated securities, fist issued last year, stood at about 33.2 billion drams.
According to him, the total amount of securities on active accounts of the Central Depository stood at about 911.4 billion drams.
He said also a total of 142 billion drams worth corporate transactions were effected last year, while the depositary blocked 120 billion drams worth bonds, including 35 billion drams as collateral.
The Central Depository of Armenia, the only centralized custodian and the registrar in Armenia, is a subsidiary of NASDAQ OMX Armenia, which is part of NASDAQ OMX Group Inc.-0-

md.descriptions.md.title: ANELIK BANK AWARDS WINNERS OF MONEY TRANSFER COMPETITION

news.metadata.block.md.text.preview: BANKING NEWSYEREVAN, February 19. / ARKA /. Armenia-based Anelik Bank held a special ceremony today to award winners of a completion it had announced earlier for customers using money transfer systems. The competition was designed for all those

title.sort-title: ANELIK BANK AWARDS WINNERS OF MONEY TRANSFER COMPETITION

text.p: BANKING NEWS

YEREVAN, February 19. / ARKA /. Armenia-based Anelik Bank held a special ceremony today to award winners of a completion it had announced earlier for customers using money transfer systems. The competition was designed for all those customers, who would send or receive money transfers from November 1 to December 30, 2014 regardless of the amounts and frequency of remittances. The drawing of prizes was held on January 23.
Deputy CEO of the bank, Hayk Mkrtchyan, handed the prizes - tablets, smartphones and certificates for free subscription to Internet services for a period of three months.

A press officer for the bank, Astghik Martirosyan, called on winners who were not present at the award ceremony, to look for their names on the list of awardees on the website of the bank or on its page in Facebook and visit the bank to get their gifts.

She was quoted as saying in a press release that the bank will continue to organize similar competitions, special offers and promotions especially in 2015 which marks the 25th anniversary of Anelik Bank.
Anelik Bank established in 1990 is owned now fully by Lebanese CreditBank.

The bank's assets grew last year by 45% to 87 billion drams, up from 60 billion drams in 2013; its liabilities grew by almost 55% to have reached 72.6 billion drams, while its loan portfolio surged by almost 50% to 58.6 billion drams. Profit before tax stood at 538 million drams against 1.4 billion drams in losses the bank incurred in 2013. ($1 - 479.16 drams). -0-

md.descriptions.md.title: EBRD AMD-DENOMINATED BONDS LISTED AT NASDAQ OMX ARMENIA

news.metadata.block.md.text.preview: STOCK MARKETYEREVAN, February 19. / ARKA /. On February 19, 2015 the third issue of AMD denominated coupon bonds by European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD) were listed at NASDAQ Armenia on the main Abond list.

title.sort-title: EBRD AMD-DENOMINATED BONDS LISTED AT NASDAQ OMX ARMENIA

text.p: STOCK MARKET

YEREVAN, February 19. / ARKA /. On February 19, 2015 the third issue of AMD denominated coupon bonds by European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD) were listed at NASDAQ Armenia on the main Abond list.

The EBRD's bonds comprising of 200,000 coupon bonds with nominal value of AMD 10,000, coupon rate of 14.5%, maturity period of 6 months will be traded under EBRDB3 ticker symbol and allowed to manual and REPO trading as well. Bonds have been assigned AMEBRDB63UK7 ISIN by Central Depository of Armenia.

To recall, on February 11, 2015 placement of this issue of bonds by EBRD took place at NASDAQ Armenia. Buy orders for a total amount of AMD 2.792 billion were placed for the bonds, as a result of which the bonds were fully allocated. The Issuer has attracted AMD 2 bilion from placement.

This is the third issue of the EBRD's bonds listed on the main Abond list. The first issue of AMD denominated coupon bonds with floating rate was redeemed on February 02, 2015 and the second issue will be redeemed on July 30, 2015.

NASDAQ OMX Armenia is the new name of the Armenian Stock Exchange ojsc (renamed on January 27, 2009), however, it is also used to refer jointly to the stock exchange and the Central Depository of Armenia ojsc (CDA), as the both companies have been members of the NASDAQ OMX Group, Inc. since early 2008.

NASDAQ OMX Armenia and the CDA are the major securities market infrastructure institutions in Armenia. Since their inception in 2000, both companies had operated as self-regulatory organizations established by member broker companies, up until demutualization in 2007.
NASDAQ OMX Armenia is a part of the world's largest exchange company, the NASDAQ OMX Group, Inc.

EBRD is an international organization formed under the Agreement Establishing the Bank dated 29th May, 1990 (the "Agreement"), signed by 40 countries, together with the European Economic Community and the European Investment Bank. The Agreement came into force on 28th March, 1991 and the Bank commenced operations on 15th April, 1991. EBRD has currently 66 members including Armenia. The Company's principal office is in London.

md.descriptions.md.title: CARFAX SERVICE AVAILABLE IN ARMENIA

news.metadata.block.md.text.preview: INFORMATION TECHNOLOGIESYEREVAN, February 18. / ARKA /. Carfax, a commercial web-based service that supplies vehicle history reports to individuals and businesses on used cars and light trucks is now available in Armenia. In Armenia the service is

title.sort-title: CARFAX SERVICE AVAILABLE IN ARMENIA

text.p: YEREVAN, February 18. / ARKA /. Carfax, a commercial web-based service that supplies vehicle history reports to individuals and businesses on used cars and light trucks is now available in Armenia. In Armenia the service is available through 4car.am website designed for motorists. It is the official partner of CARFAX in Armenia.
Carfax tracks the history of every vehicle based on its Vehicle Identification Number (VIN), the information of which can be helpful when buying a used car.
Carfax offers several free products and services and charges a fee for more comprehensive reports.

"Providing CARFAX services to Armenian motorists buying used cars from the USA through "one window "is part of our policy of offering comprehensive services. We are going to unveil new services very soon, including online request and payment of property tax, a request for a license plate from mobile phone and so on," Levon Yeghian, director of Dralvtek company that created 4car.am said.
The 4car.am was founded in 2012 by young professionals from Microsoft Innovation Center with the support from Nikita Mobile. - 0-

md.descriptions.md.title: RUSSIA'S VKONTAKTE AND YANDEX AMONG TEN MOST POPULAR RESOURCES IN WORLD

news.metadata.block.md.text.preview: INFORMATION TECHNOLOGIESYEREVAN, February 16. /ARKA/. Russia's VKontakte social network and Yandex search engine are among top ten popular in the world in all the categories, Lenta.ru reports referring to SimilarWeb company's study.

title.sort-title: RUSSIA'S VKONTAKTE AND YANDEX AMONG TEN MOST POPULAR RESOURCES IN WORLD

text.p: YEREVAN, February 16. /ARKA/. Russia's VKontakte social network and Yandex search engine are among top ten popular in the world in all the categories, Lenta.ru reports referring to SimilarWeb company's study.

The social network established by Pavel Durov came sixth in the ranking and Yandex ninth. Another Russian social network, Odnoklassniki, and Mail.ru website found themselves among top 20 - they ranked 17th and 18 respectively.
Three flagship resources are Facebook, Google and Youtube. The remaining resources in top ten are Yahoo, Live.com of Microsoft, Wikipedia, Twitter and Indian version of Google.
Earlier, VKontakte and Yandex were included in the SimilarWeb list of the most popular websites in the United States in 2014. They came 81st and 91st respectively in this ranking.

SimilarWeb Ltd is an information technology company that provides services in Web analysis, data mining and business intelligence for international corporations. Through its main platform called SimilarWeb, it uses Big data technologies to collect, measure, analyze and provide user engagement statistics for Web sites and mobile apps.

VKontakte social network was launched in October 2006. Mail.ru Group became the full owner of the social network in September 2014. VKontakte is the most visited website in runet. According to the statistical reports, the daily number of its unique visitors reached 70 million in January.
Yandex is Russia's biggest search engine. More than 60 million people visit it every month. M.V.-----0---

md.descriptions.md.title: EBRD ISSUES COUPON BONDS WORTH 2BLN DRAMS IN NASDAQ OMX ARMENIA

news.metadata.block.md.text.preview: STOCK MARKETYEREVAN, February 12. /ARKA/. The European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD) placed its third AMD denominated bonds (EBRDB3) worth a total of 2 billion drams in NASDAQ OMX Armenia stock exchange, the press office of the

title.sort-title: EBRD ISSUES COUPON BONDS WORTH 2BLN DRAMS IN NASDAQ OMX ARMENIA

text.p: STOCK MARKET

YEREVAN, February 12. /ARKA/. The European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD) placed its third AMD denominated bonds (EBRDB3) worth a total of 2 billion drams in NASDAQ OMX Armenia stock exchange, the press office of the stock exchange reported.
Total bid volume amounted to 2.792 billion drams, and the cut-off yield rate was 14.5%.
Placement was organized by Ameriabank CJSC, with the total number of bidder market participants being 4.
The second first issue of AMD denominated bonds (EBRDB2) by EBRD is already listed at Bonds' Main list (Abond) of NASDAQ Armenia and will be redeemed on July 30, 2015.

EBRD is an international organization formed under the Agreement Establishing the Bank dated 29th May, 1990 (the "Agreement"), signed by 40 countries, together with the European Economic Community and the European Investment Bank. The Agreement came into force on 28th March, 1991 and the Bank commenced operations on 15th April, 1991. The Bank has currently 66 members including Armenia. The Bank's principal office is in London.
EBRD is one of the biggest investors in Armenia. It has implemented 136 programs in thecountry by the end of 2014 worth a total of about 803 million euros.

In January 2008, Nordic exchange operator OMX Group acquired 100% of the shares of the Armenian Stock Exchange (Armex) and the Central Depository of Armenia (CDA). After the combination of NASDAQ and OMX in February 2008, Armex and CDA became fully owned by the NASDAQ OMX Group, Inc. On January 26, 2009, "Armenian Stock Exchange" ojsc was officially renamed as "NASDAQ OMX Armenia" ojsc. On June 5, 2009, "NASDAQ OMX Armenia" ojsc became the owner of 100% of the shares of the "Central Depository of Armenia" ojsc. Starting October 1, 2014 "NASDAQ OMX Armenia" ojsc and "Central Depository of Armenia" ojsc operate under "Nasdaq Armenia" brand. N.V. -0-

md.descriptions.md.title: APPLE FIRST COMPANY IN HISTORY WORTH OVER $700 BLN

news.metadata.block.md.text.preview: INFORMATION TECHNOLOGIESYEREVAN, February 11. /ARKA/. Apple has become the first company to reach a market value of $700 billion, Dailymail.co.uk reports.

title.sort-title: APPLE FIRST COMPANY IN HISTORY WORTH OVER $700 BLN

text.p: YEREVAN, February 11. /ARKA/. Apple has become the first company to reach a market value of $700 billion, Dailymail.co.uk reports.
Shares rose 1.9 percent to close at $122.02, lifting Apple's market value to $710 billion, and making it the first company to hit the $700 billion milestone.
Apple chief executive Tim Cook, speaking at the Goldman Sachs Technology & Internet Conference, said Apple was hitting its stride.
'We've taken (the mobile operating system) iOS and extended it into your car, into your home, into your health. All of these are really critical parts of your life,' Cook said. -0--

md.descriptions.md.title: EBRD DRAM-DENOMINATED 2 BILLION DRAMS LISTED AT NASDAQ OMX ARMENIA

news.metadata.block.md.text.preview: STOCK MARKETYEREVAN, February 11. / ARKA /. Two billion drams worth bonds of the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD) of the second issue were listed on NASDAQ OMX Armenia today and included in the main Abond list, the stock

title.sort-title: EBRD DRAM-DENOMINATED 2 BILLION DRAMS LISTED AT NASDAQ OMX ARMENIA

text.p: STOCK MARKET

YEREVAN, February 11. / ARKA /. Two billion drams worth bonds of the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD) of the second issue were listed on NASDAQ OMX Armenia today and included in the main Abond list, the stock exchange said today.

It said the face value of a bond is 10,000 drams; the maturity period is 6 months and the coupon yield is 17%. EBRD bonds are assigned EBRDB2 ticker. They will be allowed to conclude targeted and repo transactions.
These bonds were placed at NASDAQ OMX Armenia on January 30, 2015. The total amount of submitted bids (aggregate demand) totaled 2.908 billion drams.

The bonds were fully placed, attracting 2 billion drams. The first issue of EBRD coupon dram-denominated bonds with a floating rate (EBRDB1) in the amount of 2 billion drams were placed in 2014 February and were repaid on February 2, 2015.

NASDAQ OMX Armenia is the new name of the Armenian Stock Exchange ojsc (renamed on January 27, 2009), however, it is also used to refer jointly to the stock exchange and the Central Depository of Armenia ojsc (CDA), as the both companies have been members of the NASDAQ OMX Group, Inc. since early 2008.

NASDAQ OMX Armenia and the CDA are the major securities market infrastructure institutions in Armenia. Since their inception in 2000, both companies had operated as self-regulatory organizations established by member broker companies, up until demutualization in 2007.
NASDAQ OMX Armenia is a part of the world's largest exchange company, the NASDAQ OMX Group, Inc.

The EBRD is one of the largest investors in Armenia. Since its inception in Armenia in 1992 it has financed implementation of 136 programs in the field of energy and infrastructure, as well as in the financial sector, worth 803 million euros. -0-

md.descriptions.md.title: ARKA NEWS AGENCY CORRESPONDENT WINS ROSTELECOM'S CONTEST IN TWITTER

news.metadata.block.md.text.preview: INFORMATION TECHNOLOGIESYEREVAN, February 10. /ARKA/. Inna Verlinskaya, a correspondent at ARKA News Agency, has won Russian Rostelecom Telecommunication Company's contest in Twitter, the company's press office reported on Monday.

title.sort-title: ARKA NEWS AGENCY CORRESPONDENT WINS ROSTELECOM'S CONTEST IN TWITTER

text.p: YEREVAN, February 10. /ARKA/. Inna Verlinskaya, a correspondent at ARKA News Agency, has won Russian Rostelecom Telecommunication Company's contest in Twitter, the company's press office reported on Monday.
On September 29, 2014, Rostelecom announced its Fourth Annual Contest of Journalists titled 'Technologies for Life - Light Velocity Internet' in Russia.
The grand prize in this contest is a trip with a Russian delegation to Huawei headquarters in Shenzhen, China in autumn 2015.

This project was launched in Armenia on December 23. Along with this contest announcement, another contest announcement appeared on the company's page in Twitter - contenders here had to translate a record about the launch of the contest in Armenia from Armenian to Russian language.
"We are happy to name the winner - Inna Verlinskaya, ARKA News Agency's correspondent, to whom a corporate gift was handed in recent days," the company says in its press release.

The company also says that 'Technologies for Life - Light Velocity Internet' contest is under way now and every media representative who has a published article related to telecommunication may join this race by posting the article on www.smi.rt.ru. The winner from Armenia will travel to China together with winners from Russia.

Journalists working in various areas - radio, television, Internet and news agencies, as well as bloggers may take part in the contest. The best articles will be selected by the professional jury made up of representatives of IT community and Armenian media outlets.

Karen Vardanyan; the executive director of the Union of Information Technology Enterprises; Bagrat Yengibaryan, director of the Enterprise Incubator Foundation; Yeva Yusyan, head of Microsoft Armenia; Galina Davidyan, director of Novosti-Armenia International News Agency, head of Rostelecom Group's GNC-Alfa CJSC and director of Armenpress News Agency Aram Ananyan.
The first contest was conducted in 2011. It attracts no less than 500 articles every year.

'Technologies for Life' project is being implemented to attract media outlets and bloggers to unbiased and higher-quality coverage of innovative technologies and services and their application in various areas.
Details are available on www.smi.rt.ru. Applications are received here. The application submission deadline is April 10, 2015.

The contest is organized by Rostelecom jointly with Huawei, the Russian Association of Electronic Communications and Mikhaylov&Partners under information support from flagship regional Russian and Armenian media outlets.

GNC-ALFA CJSC, Armenian subsidiary of Russia's Rostelecom, started selling telecommunication services in December 2012 under Rostelecom brand. In late 2012, it offered super-speed Internet as well as IP television and telephony services to clients.
The company's fiber optic network covers 80% of Armenia's territory stretching 2,500 kilometers across the country.
The company has built a backbone fiber optic cable from Iran, as well as two outputs through Georgia. M.V.--0--
